etymology.description: abbreviated 手(手) (shǒu, "hand") + 糸(糸) (mì, "silk") = hand manipulating thread -> simplified -> used as simplified form of 繫(繫) (xì, "connect")
etymology.interpretation: The character 系(系) (xì, "continue") combines 手(手) (shǒu, "hand") and 糸(糸) (mì, "silk"), depicting a hand weaving or tying thread, symbolizing continuity or connection. It simplifies the more complex 繫(繫) (xì, "connect") by merging the elements concisely.
etymology.simplification: Simplified by merging components into a unified character, omitting 人(人) (rén, "person") and retaining essential elements from related forms like 繫(繫) (xì, "connect") and 係(係) (xì, "relate").

examples.chinese: 课程系进行到下学期(課程系進行到下學期)。
examples.pinyin: Kèchéng xì jìnxíng dào xià xuéqī.
examples.english: The course continues into the next semester.

examples.chinese: 旅程系向未知方向展开(旅程系向未知方向展開)。
examples.pinyin: Lǚchéng xì xiàng wèizhī fāngxiàng zhǎnkāi.
examples.english: The journey continues unfolding in an unknown direction.

examples.chinese: 讨论系持续深入(討論系持續深入)。
examples.english: The discussion continues to delve deeper.
